etymology.description: Pictogram (象形): a sprout emerging from the ground.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a shoot pushing up through the soil: the horizontal stroke suggests the ground, while the central vertical stroke and side strokes evoke the stem and small leaves. Early oracle and bronze forms closely resemble a budding plant.

examples.chinese: 在甲骨文中，屮表示植物的嫩芽(在甲骨文中，屮表示植物的嫩芽)。
examples.pinyin: Zài jiǎgǔwén zhōng, chè biǎoshì zhíwù de nènyá.
examples.english: In oracle script, 屮 represents a plant sprout.

examples.chinese: 春天雨后，田里冒出许多嫩芽，像“屮”的形状(春天雨後，田裡冒出許多嫩芽，像「屮」的形狀)。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān yǔ hòu, tián lǐ mào chū xǔduō nènyá, xiàng “chè” de xíngzhuàng.
examples.english: After spring rains, many sprouts emerge in the fields, resembling the shape of “屮”.

examples.chinese: 屮在古文字中象征嫩芽与新生(屮在古文字中象徵嫩芽與新生)。
examples.pinyin: Chè zài gǔ wénzì zhōng xiàngzhēng nènyá yǔ xīnshēng.
examples.english: In ancient scripts, 屮 symbolizes sprouts and new life.
